page.title: 13TREVELGUE HEAD
page.content: It has been speculated that the ramparts were a status symbol-the bigger they were the more important its builders were. In l939, Mr.Croft Andrew excavated Trevelgue, but as the war built up in intensity, the excavations had to stop, due to a lack of resources. This meant that there was not a thorough excavation.Also little information was published. In l949 in the November/December Archaeology Newsletter, a short account of the excavation was written by Croft Andrew. A full report of the excavation has never been written but this year (1985) a report is in progress. The finds made and reported in the 1940 newsletter were varied and spanned considerable time.
